column4: Is it possible to switch between KDE and GNOME without a fresh install?
I may be (probably am) taking this the wrong way, but are you suggesting that kubuntu desktop is only 44kB? :p
thats only the base package..  it will install a crapload of other packages when you run that command
How would I go about ridding myself of KDE and getting GNOME?
i thought you wanted to install kde?
I have Kubuntu right now, but it runs slowly because this is, for lack of a better term, a shiess computer.
i see.. you should be able to install gnome and remove kde.... it'll probably take some work though
I love me a challenge, would you be able to direct me towards some documentation perhaps?
i like xfce. how old of a pc are we talking?.. specs?
Old enough to run Gnome, I would think. P4 2.53 512 RAM.
yeah, it should run gnome fine
i'd clean install xfce, gnome, flux, whatever else you want to try, then clean install the one you want...
i believe, there's a program you can download to do it... but naturally, no i don't think so.
Ok. I'll start googling like a madman. THANKS
